instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.TPS62180: What is TPS62180? This is a power chip responsible for many different power rails on 2016-2020 Macbook Pros,  most often known as the SSD buck converter chip responsible for NAND power rails.
definitions.CD3127: What is CD3127? This is a common typo,  the person typing CD3127 was most likely referring to a CD3217.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.
definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
Hi,

board came with no signs of life whatsoever, taking only 5V.. measured PPBUS and it was partially shorted (I kinda know this is not an easy one when it's a partial short) around 9 ohms in resistance and 0.012 in diode mode. 

Injected 2 volts since 1v was not enough and my initial suspicion was correct it was the haunted <CHIP>TPS62180</CHIP>.. and on board it looked little discolored to my on the visual inspection.. 
Removed and replaced successfully now left ports take 20V for 2 seconds then switch to 5v and cycle.. on the right side it does not even power on the amp meter.. I replaced the CD3217B12 and it did not resolve the issue.. 

I measured the diode mode on the LDOs of <CHIP>CD3127</CHIP> and it seemed OK according to OBD. Where do I look next?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on CC1/2 lines of USB-C ports.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message: I compared both JG600 (suspect) and JF600 (known-good) USB-C ports and they are good.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
Yesterday port was not even turning on now the port turns on, on 5V without power draw whatsoever.. I measured;

CC line present 1[B].6v [/B]
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC2</SIGNAL> [B]5.1v [/B]
UPC2_SS [B]not[/B] [B]present[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC2_LDO_CORE</SIGNAL> [B]present[/B]
PP3V3_UPC2_LDO [B]present [/B]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> [B]not present [/B]

although <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> on another USB-C port it is present

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
Thinking I may have rushed swapping CD3217s I returned the original one and now CC1/CC2 lines are not present. 
I believe it's a <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> issue but the one I put is not compatible maybe? I took it from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
I have returned the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> with ROM chip.. still same thing 5V and CC line 1.6v went back.. 
I have measured PP5V_S2SW_USBC23 in diode mode and it was very low around 0.108.. I measured both coils and they were still low up until I started to measure PPVIN_5VUSBC23_ISNS my multimeter got stuck and then diode mode reading went up as I watch up to 0.480 
IDK what is going on? Is <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> pulling it down?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
CC1/2 lines must have complementary voltage; depends how the power cable is connected.
Keep in mind, you can connect the cable in two ways on each port.
CC1/2 lines are used to determine if cable is flipped.

People on Internet claims that may be differences between <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips with small, or big dot marking.
Be sure first to use chips with same termination code.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message: The original CD3217B12 was 18P19VS the one I put is 11P0SSS, both were small dots..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message: B12 is the termination code there...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
B12 on both.. but I've encountered late 2020 MacBooks refusing to some B12s with similar dot size.. they accept certain CDs with the exact board or smilier codes.. 
What do you suggest?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message: Took a <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with its ROM chip and installed them and it successfully repaired the issue taking 20V and booting into system.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Pro 14" PPBUS partial short
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback.
This may help other members in the future.
